thread.title: Sabres lose goal, goalie and game
thread.title_full: Sabres lose goal, goalie and game - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Sabres lose goal, goalie and game
text:
Buffalo
Kyle Turris scored twice and the Ottawa Senators won a coach's challenge to overturn a goal by the Sabres in the third period to hang on for a 3-1 victory in the teams' season opener on Thursday night.
With 9:26 left, Buffalo's Evander Kane scored on a wraparound that would have tied the score at 2. Senators coach Dave Cameron challenged the goal, and a video review showed Sabres forward Zemgus Girgensons was offside when Buffalo entered the zone.
Jack Eichel , an 18-year-old rookie, scored a power-play goal for Buffalo, whose starting goalie Robin Lehner did not return after appearing to hurt his left leg 7:30 into the second period.
Jets 6, Bruins 2: This was the first victory for the former Atlanta Thrashers in Boston since 2007, before the franchise moved to Winnipeg.
Lightning 3, Flyers 2 (OT): Jason Garrison 's second goal gave Tampa Bay the win.
Predators 2, Hurricanes 1: Craig Smith and Viktor Arvidsson scored for Nashville.
Blues 3, Oilers 1: Robby Fabbri broke a 1-1 tie midway through the third period.
Stars 3, Penguins 0: Antti Niemi stopped 32 shots for a shutout.
Wild 5, Avalanche 4: Zach Parise scored three times, including the tiebreaking tally in the third period.
